author: Special Correspondent
text:
A 55-year-old man, Nagaiah, was stabbed to death following a quarrel among relatives at a village under Palamedu police station limits on Wednesday night.

The police said that Nagaiah and his cousin Muniyandi of 66 Usilampatti had long-running enmity.

On Wednesday, Nagaiah and his family and his cousins attended a function at one of their relatives’place, where Muniyandi and his brothers are said to have beaten up Nagaiah’s son Prabhakaran.

When Nagaiah intervened, one of them in the crowd stabbed him with a knife. Nagaiah was rushed to the Primary Health Centre in Palamedu, where he was referred to Government Rajaji Hospital (GRH) here.

However, before he could be taken to the GRH, he succumbed to his injury.

Palamedu police have picked up a few suspects in this connection.
title: 55-year-old stabbed to death
